008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.image;
010
011import ij.process.Blitter;
012import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
013
014/**
015 * This class defines static methods for non-destructive, arithmetic operations on ImageJ's 
016 * {@link ImageProcessor} objects.
017 * Unlike the built-in {@link ImageProcessor} methods, the methods below
018 * return new images and keep the original images unmodified.
019 * 
020 * @version 2013/08/23: static methods converted to use generics.
021 */
022public abstract class ImageMath {
023        
024        private ImageMath() {}
025        
026        /**
027         * Calculates the absolute pixel values of the specified image
028         * and returns a new image of the same type.
029         *  
030         * @param <T> the type of {@link ImageProcessor}
031         * @param ip the input image
032         * @return the resulting image
033         */
034        public static <T extends ImageProcessor> T abs(T ip) {
035                @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
036                T ip2 = (T) ip.duplicate();
037                ip2.abs();
038                return ip2;
039        }
040        
041        /**
042         * Calculates the squared pixel values of the specified image
043         * and returns a new image of the same type.
044         *  
045         * @param <T> the type of {@link ImageProcessor}
046         * @param ip the input image
047         * @return the resulting image
048         */
049        public static <T extends ImageProcessor> T sqr(T ip) {
050                @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
051                T ip2 = (T) ip.duplicate();
052                ip2.sqr();
053                return ip2;
054        }
055        
056        /**
057         * Calculates the square root of the pixel values of the specified image
058         * and returns a new image of the same type.
059         *  
060         * @param <T> the type of {@link ImageProcessor}
061         * @param ip the input image
062         * @return the resulting image
063         */
064        public static <T extends ImageProcessor> T sqrt(T ip) {
065                @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
066                T ip2 = (T) ip.duplicate();
067                ip2.sqrt();
068                return ip2;
069        }
070        
071        /**
072         * Adds the pixel values of the specified images
073         * and returns a new image of the same type
074         * as the first image.
075         *  
076         * @param <T> the type of {@link ImageProcessor}
077         * @param ip1 first input image
078         * @param ip2 second input image
079         * @return the resulting image
080         */
081        public static<T extends ImageProcessor> T add(T ip1, T ip2) {
082                if (!ip1.getClass().equals(ip2.getClass())) {
083                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("input images must be of the same type");
084                }
085                @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
086                T ip3 = (T) ip1.duplicate();
087                ip3.copyBits(ip2, 0, 0, Blitter.ADD);
088                return ip3;
089        }
090        
091        /**
092         * Multiplies the pixel values of the specified images
093         * and returns a new image of the same type
094         * as the first image.
095         *  
096         * @param <T> the type of {@link ImageProcessor}
097         * @param ip1 first input image
098         * @param ip2 second input image
099         * @return the resulting image
100         */
101        public static<T extends ImageProcessor> T mult(T ip1, T ip2) {
102                if (!ip1.getClass().equals(ip2.getClass())) {
103                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("input images must be of the same type");
104                }
105                @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
106                T ip3 = (T) ip1.duplicate();
107                ip3.copyBits(ip2, 0, 0, Blitter.MULTIPLY);
108                return ip3;
109        }
110
111}
